translated: The First Chapter: The Attainment of Cessation🔽The Question about the Attainment of Cessation

original: “bhante nāgasena, yo na paṭisandahati, jānāti so ‘na paṭisandahissāmī’”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena yaḥ na paṭisandahati jānāti saḥ na paṭisandahissāmi iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, does he who does not attain know ‘I shall not attain’?”

original: “Āma, mahārāja, yo na paṭisandahati, jānāti so ‘na paṭisandahissāmī’”ti.
analyzed: āma mahā rāja yaḥ na paṭisandahati jānāti saḥ na paṭisandahissāmi iti
translated: “Yes, sire, he who does not attain knows ‘I shall not attain.’”

original: “Yo hetu yo paccayo, mahārāja, paṭisandahanāya, tassa hetussa tassa paccayassa uparamā jānāti so ‘na paṭisandahissāmī’”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ hetu yaḥ paccayaḥ mahā rāja paṭisandahanāya tassa hetussa tassa paccayassa uparamā jānāti saḥ na paṭisandahissāmi iti
translated: “Because, sire, of the cessation of the cause and the condition for the attainment, he knows ‘I shall not attain.’”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, kassako gahapatiko kasitvā ca vapitvā ca dhaññāgāraṁ paripūreyya.🔽So aparena samayena neva kasseyya na vappeyya, yathāsambhatañca dhaññaṁ paribhuñjeyya
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja kassakaḥ gahapatikaḥ kasitvā ca vapitvā ca dhaññāgāram paripūreyya  saḥ aparena samayena na iva kasseyya na vappeyya yathāsambhatam ca dhaññam paribhuñjeyya
translated: “As, sire, a farmer-householder, having ploughed and sown, might fill his granary;

original: vā visajjeyya vā yathā paccayaṁ vā kareyya, jāneyya so, mahārāja, kassako gahapatiko
analyzed: vā visajjeyya vā yathā paccayam vā kareyya jāneyya saḥ mahā rāja kassakaḥ gahapatiko
translated: and after some time he might neither plough nor sow, but might use up what he had stored or might send it away or might do with it as he wished;
would that farmer-householder, sire, know ‘My granary will not be filled’?”

original: “Yo hetu yo paccayo dhaññāgārassa paripūraṇāya, tassa hetussa tassa paccayassa uparamā jānāti ‘na me dhaññāgāraṁ paripūressatī’”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ hetu yaḥ paccayaḥ dhaññāgārassa paripūraṇāya tassa hetussa tassa paccayassa uparamā jānāti na me dhaññāgāram paripūressati iti
translated: “Because of the cessation of the cause and condition for the granary to be filled up, he knows that his granary will not be filled up.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, yo hetu yo paccayo paṭisandahanāya, tassa hetussa tassa paccayassa uparamā jānāti so ‘na paṭisandahissāmī’”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yaḥ hetu yaḥ paccayaḥ paṭisandahanāya tassa hetussa tassa paccayassa uparamā jānāti saḥ na paṭisandahissāmi iti
translated: “Even so, sire, because of the cessation of the cause and condition for rebirth-linking, he knows that he will not be reborn.”
